Funding a Future Obligation
There are many TVM applications where it is necessary to determine the size of the
deposit(s) that must be made over a specified period in order to meet a future liability.
Two common examples of this type of application are (1) setting up a funding program
for future college tuition and (2) the funding of a retirement program. In most of
these applications, the objective is to determine the size of the payment(s) or deposit(s)
necessary to meet a particular monetary goal.
